sentences.english: They weeded the mounds and piled fresh dirt atop.
sentences.chinese: 他们铲除坟上的杂草，再将在坟顶堆上新鲜的土。

sentences.english: KNEEL】She knelt down to pull weeds from the flower bed.
sentences.chinese: 他跪下拔去花坛中的杂草。

sentences.english: The same is true of seeds that pass through farm animals that graze on weeds.
sentences.chinese: 这对从耕畜粪便中排出的杂草种子也同样有效。

sentences.english: Any of several weedy composite plants of the genus artemisia.
sentences.chinese: 蒿属的任何一种混合的杂草。

sentences.english: The germination of weed seeds was effeeted by the soil moisture and temperature.
sentences.chinese: 温度和土壤湿度都是杂草发生必不可少的重要条件。

sentences.english: Competition on growth between Juncellus serotinus and Sagittaria pygmaea was evident.
sentences.chinese: 水莎草与矮慈姑两种杂草间也存在生态竞争关系。

sentences.english: He is removing weeds with a harrow in the rice field.
sentences.chinese: 他正在用耥耙给稻田除去杂草。

sentences.english: Professor Curran says another way to make use of weeds is to compost them.
sentences.chinese: 柯伦教授说，另杂草的是将其制成堆肥。

sentences.english: Into the jungle of weeds that formed a natural fence along the road.
sentences.chinese: 他走进了路边的天然屏障，走进了杂草丛生的树林里。

sentences.english: Deserts were tidy, because there were no weeds in them, nothing that crawled.
sentences.chinese: 沙漠很整洁，因为里面没有杂草，没有爬行的东西。

sentences.english: As he crumples the flowering end of the weed in his hand, Nelson grimaces.
sentences.chinese: 尼尔森苦笑着掐断手中杂草的花，把杂草弄死。

sentences.english: As he crumples the flowering end of the weed in his hand, Nelson grimaces.
sentences.chinese: 尼尔森苦笑着掐断手中杂草的花，把杂草弄死。

sentences.english: They picked out the weeds among the rice.
sentences.chinese: 他们拔除了稻丛间的杂草。

sentences.english: But a weed plant can produce tens or even hundreds of thousands of seeds.
sentences.chinese: 但每株杂草能产生数万甚至数十万颗种子。

sentences.english: I spent the whole weekend pulling up the weeds in the garden.
sentences.chinese: 我用了整个周末的时间拔除花园里的杂草。

definition: (of cereal crops) to collapse and lie flat
